intro: Rosa wormastinyana, commonly known as the New Zealand mountain rose, is a species of flowering plant native to the South Island of New Zealand. It is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and produces showy, pink to red flowers during the spring and summer months. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs, and its stems are often armed with thorns. Rosa wormastinyana thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas or on rocky slopes. It is an important component of New Zealand's native flora and has cultural significance to the Māori people.
